about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: When driving in fog, you should:

about.name: When driving in fog, you should:

hasPart.assesses: When driving in fog, you should: | When driving in fog, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers should use low beam headlights when driving in fog. High beams will reflect back at the driver, making it difficult to see.

comment.text: Use your high beam headlights.
Use your parking lights.
Use your low beam headlights.
Use your low beam headlights.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers should use low beam headlights when driving in fog. High beams will reflect back at the driver, making it difficult to see.

comment.text: When driving in fog, you should: | Drivers should use low beam headlights when driving in fog. High beams will reflect back at the driver, making it difficult to see.

hasPart.name: You want to turn left at an upcoming corner. Yield the right-of-way to:

about.name: You want to turn left at an upcoming corner. Yield the right-of-way to:

hasPart.assesses: You want to turn left at an upcoming corner. Yield the right-of-way to: | You want to turn left at an upcoming corner. Yield the right-of-way to: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When making a left turn, you must yield to pedestrians, bicyclists, or other vehicles moving on their green light.

comment.text: Oncoming vehicles also turning left.
All approaching vehicles.

suggestedAnswer.text: Pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a "Walk" signal.

comment.text: Pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a "Walk" signal.
All approaching vehicles.

answerExplanation.text: When making a left turn, you must yield to pedestrians, bicyclists, or other vehicles moving on their green light.

hasPart.name: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should:

about.name: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should:

hasPart.assesses: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should: | To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Slow down before you enter a curve because you do not know what may be ahead. Braking on a curve may cause you to skid.

suggestedAnswer.text: Shift to a lower gear after starting down a steep hill.

comment.text: Shift to a lower gear after starting down a steep hill.

suggestedAnswer.text: Speed up to enter curves and slow down to exit them.

comment.text: Speed up to enter curves and slow down to exit them.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down before entering curves and intersections.

comment.text: Slow down before entering curves and intersections.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down before entering curves and intersections.

comment.text: Slow down before entering curves and intersections.

answerExplanation.text: Slow down before you enter a curve because you do not know what may be ahead. Braking on a curve may cause you to skid.

comment.text: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should: | Slow down before you enter a curve because you do not know what may be ahead. Braking on a curve may cause you to skid.

hasPart.name: California's Move Over law requires:
hasPart.assesses: California's Move Over law requires: | California's Move Over law requires: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If an emergency vehicle with its lights on is stopped on the side of the road, California drivers are required to vacate the lane directly next to the vehicle, if possible. If a driver cannot move over safely, they must slow down and proceed with caution. This law also applies when approaching a stopped tow truck or Department of Transportation vehicle.

suggestedAnswer.text: All vehicles to stay in the right lane at all times.

comment.text: All vehicles to stay in the right lane at all times.

suggestedAnswer.text: Trucks to use the left lane.

comment.text: Trucks to use the left lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: All vehicles to vacate the lane closest to an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its lights flashing.

comment.text: All vehicles to vacate the lane closest to an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its lights flashing.

acceptedAnswer.text: All vehicles to vacate the lane closest to an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its lights flashing.

comment.text: All vehicles to vacate the lane closest to an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its lights flashing.

answerExplanation.text: If an emergency vehicle with its lights on is stopped on the side of the road, California drivers are required to vacate the lane directly next to the vehicle, if possible. If a driver cannot move over safely, they must slow down and proceed with caution. This law also applies when approaching a stopped tow truck or Department of Transportation vehicle.

comment.text: California's Move Over law requires: | If an emergency vehicle with its lights on is stopped on the side of the road, California drivers are required to vacate the lane directly next to the vehicle, if possible. If a driver cannot move over safely, they must slow down and proceed with caution. This law also applies when approaching a stopped tow truck or Department of Transportation vehicle.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: California's Move Over law requires: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: When you drive through a construction zone, you should:

about.name: When you drive through a construction zone, you should:

hasPart.assesses: When you drive through a construction zone, you should: | When you drive through a construction zone, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: To avoid contributing to chronic traffic congestion, you should not "rubberneck." That is, you should not slow down to look at out-of-the-ordinary things.

comment.text: Stop to watch the workers.
Decrease your following distance.

suggestedAnswer.text: Pass the construction zone carefully and not “rubberneck."

comment.text: Pass the construction zone carefully and not “rubberneck."

acceptedAnswer.text: Pass the construction zone carefully and not “rubberneck."

comment.text: Pass the construction zone carefully and not “rubberneck."

answerExplanation.text: To avoid contributing to chronic traffic congestion, you should not "rubberneck." That is, you should not slow down to look at out-of-the-ordinary things.

comment.text: When you drive through a construction zone, you should: | To avoid contributing to chronic traffic congestion, you should not "rubberneck." That is, you should not slow down to look at out-of-the-ordinary things.

hasPart.name: This symbol is used for:
hasPart.assesses: This symbol is used for: | This symbol is used for: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A reflective orange triangle on the rear of a vehicle means it travels only at slow speeds. You may see this sign on roadwork equipment, farm vehicles, or horse-drawn wagons and carriages. It appears as a solid orange triangle during the day and a hollow red triangle at night.

comment.text: Dangerous intersections.
Slow-moving vehicles.
Yield signs.
Slow-moving vehicles.

answerExplanation.text: A reflective orange triangle on the rear of a vehicle means it travels only at slow speeds. You may see this sign on roadwork equipment, farm vehicles, or horse-drawn wagons and carriages. It appears as a solid orange triangle during the day and a hollow red triangle at night.

comment.text: This symbol is used for: | A reflective orange triangle on the rear of a vehicle means it travels only at slow speeds. You may see this sign on roadwork equipment, farm vehicles, or horse-drawn wagons and carriages. It appears as a solid orange triangle during the day and a hollow red triangle at night.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: This symbol is used for: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
